docs.abstract: Another election technology company, Smartmatic, is suing news outlets, including Fox, over false claims of election fraud, and Dominion has other cases pending.
docs.snippet: Another election technology company, Smartmatic, is suing news outlets, including Fox, over false claims of election fraud, and Dominion has other cases pending.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, Fox News hastily agreed to pay $787.5 million to resolve a defamation suit filed by Dominion Voting Systems — among the largest settlements ever in a defamation case — just hours after the jury for the trial was selected. In addition to the whopping financial settlement, Fox conceded that “certain claims” it had made about Dominion were false.

headline.main: Fox News Settled Its Suit, but Similar 2020 Election Cases Are Pending
headline.print_headline: Suit Is Settled, But New Ones On Vote Claims Are on the Way

docs.abstract: The settlement with Dominion Voting Systems was the latest extraordinary twist in a case that exposed the inner workings of the most powerful voice in conservative news.
docs.snippet: The settlement with Dominion Voting Systems was the latest extraordinary twist in a case that exposed the inner workings of the most powerful voice in conservative news.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fox News abruptly agreed on Tuesday to pay $787.5 million to resolve a defamation suit filed by Dominion Voting Systems over the network’s promotion of misinformation about the 2020 election, averting a lengthy and embarrassing trial just as a packed courtroom was seated in anticipation of hearing opening statements.

headline.main: Fox Will Pay $787.5 Million to Settle Defamation Suit
headline.print_headline: Fox And Dominion Abruptly Settle For $787.5 Million

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Katie Robertson

docs.abstract: Artists, dealers and collectors are waiting to see if UTA’s new gallery space will lift Southern talents — or focus on big names outside the region.
docs.snippet: Artists, dealers and collectors are waiting to see if UTA’s new gallery space will lift Southern talents — or focus on big names outside the region.
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — On a recent weekday evening in this city’s Midtown neighborhood, hundreds of people, including Stacey Abrams, the former nominee for governor of Georgia, and Andre Dickens, the city’s mayor, came together for a celebration. They weren’t there to campaign, but to commemorate the opening of an artist’s gallery created by United Talent Agency, the global entertainment company better known for representing musicians and actors.

headline.main: Can a Global Talent Agency Make Atlanta an Art Destination?
headline.print_headline: Making Atlanta A Hub For Art

docs.abstract: Financial advisers recommend that business owners examine their accounts now to ensure they are protected in case of a future bank failure.
docs.snippet: Financial advisers recommend that business owners examine their accounts now to ensure they are protected in case of a future bank failure.
docs.lead_paragraph: The collapse of two regional lenders, Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank, last month caused a ripple of panic among small businesses across the country as owners watched the news unfold and wondered whether their assets were safe — even if their deposits were not in one of the failed institutions.

headline.main: How Small Businesses Can Find Safety Before the Next Bank Crisis
headline.print_headline: How Small Businesses Can Take Precautions To Secure Their Assets

docs.abstract: Ari Emanuel’s Endeavor acquires World Wrestling Entertainment to create a live event and combat sport giant.
docs.snippet: Ari Emanuel’s Endeavor acquires World Wrestling Entertainment to create a live event and combat sport giant.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ari Emanuel’s media colossus Endeavor, whose properties include the Ultimate Fighting Championship, has agreed to buy World Wrestling Entertainment, creating a live event behemoth and cementing its status as a leader in combat sport competitions.

headline.main: A Hollywood Superagent Buys a Pro Wrestling Heavyweight

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

docs.abstract: Two recent openings testify to the power, and joy, of queer spaces.
docs.snippet: Two recent openings testify to the power, and joy, of queer spaces.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — One pleasingly bitter, gently botanical, sort-of purple nonalcoholic cocktail in, and I was just happy to be caught in the gravitational pull of the Ruby Fruit.

headline.main: The Lesbian Bar Isn’t Dead. It’s Pouring Orange Wine in Los Angeles.
headline.print_headline: In Los Angeles, New Life For the Lesbian Bar

docs.abstract: Succession plans, or the lack thereof, can hinder the transition to a new generation — and affect how loved ones fund their later years.
docs.snippet: Succession plans, or the lack thereof, can hinder the transition to a new generation — and affect how loved ones fund their later years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most workers strive to keep their personal and professional lives separate. But for people who start or inherit a family business, the opposite is true: The personal is professional. And it gets very personal when it comes to retirement.

headline.main: When Your Career, and Retirement, Are the Family’s Business
headline.print_headline: When Your Career Has Been the Family’s Business

docs.abstract: At the start of a pretrial hearing for the $1.6 billion defamation trial, the judge said he was still weighing whether to issue a summary judgment.
docs.snippet: At the start of a pretrial hearing for the $1.6 billion defamation trial, the judge said he was still weighing whether to issue a summary judgment.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Delaware judge overseeing Dominion Voting Systems’ $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit against Fox News said in a pretrial hearing on Tuesday that he was still weighing whether to issue a summary judgment for either side in the case.

headline.main: Fox and Dominion Urge Judge to Rule on Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Weighs Quick Ruling In Dominion V. Fox News

docs.abstract: The producer, Abby Grossberg, said in a pair of lawsuits that the effort to place blame on her and Maria Bartiromo, the Fox Business host, was rooted in rampant misogyny and discrimination at the company.
docs.snippet: The producer, Abby Grossberg, said in a pair of lawsuits that the effort to place blame on her and Maria Bartiromo, the Fox Business host, was rooted in rampant misogyny and discrimination at the company.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Fox News producer who has worked with the hosts Maria Bartiromo and Tucker Carlson filed lawsuits against the company in New York and Delaware on Monday, accusing Fox lawyers of coercing her into giving misleading testimony in the continuing legal battle around the network’s coverage of unfounded claims about election fraud.

headline.main: Fox Producer Says She Was Set Up in Dominion Case
headline.print_headline: Fox News Producer Says She Was Set Up in Dominion Case, Citing Misogyny at the Company

byline.original: By Nicholas Confessore and Katie Robertson

docs.abstract: As homelessness overwhelms downtown Phoenix, a small business wonders how long it can hang on.
docs.snippet: As homelessness overwhelms downtown Phoenix, a small business wonders how long it can hang on.
docs.lead_paragraph: He had been coming into work at the same sandwich shop at the same exact time every weekday morning for the last four decades, but now Joe Faillace, 69, pulled up to Old Station Subs with no idea what to expect. He parked on a street lined with three dozen tents, grabbed his Mace and unlocked the door to his restaurant. The peace sign was still hanging above the entryway. Fake flowers remained undisturbed on every table. He picked up the phone and dialed his wife and business partner, Debbie Faillace, 60.

headline.main: A Sandwich Shop, a Tent City and an American Crisis
headline.print_headline: A Homeless Camp Crisis At a Sandwich Shop’s Door

byline.original: By Eli Saslow and Todd Heisler
